alert.note: Alert for Coke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 4:29PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN COKE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM CST... At 428 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, or 7 miles west of E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Sanco, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, and The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
